message_1:
During the last 12 months, a company's sales record shows the following monthly sales in thousands of dollars: 

January - 23, February - 28, March - 30, April - 33, May - 36, June - 38, July - 40, August - 45, September - 48, October - 52, November - 55, December - 58.

Using time series analysis, calculate the moving average for a window of 3 months and interpret the results.
message_2:
To calculate the moving average for a window of 3 months, we will take the average of each consecutive 3-month period. Here are the calculations:

1. (January + February + March) / 3 = (23 + 28 + 30) / 3 = 81 / 3 = 27
2. (February + March + April) / 3 = (28 + 30 + 33) / 3 = 91 / 3 = 30.33
3. (March + April + May) / 3 = (30 + 33 + 36) / 3 = 99 / 3 = 33
4. (April + May + June) / 3 = (33 + 36 + 38) / 3 = 107 / 3 = 35.67
5. (May + June + July) / 3 = (36 + 38 + 40) / 3 = 114 / 3 = 38
6. (June + July + August) / 3 = (38 + 40 + 45) / 3 = 123 / 3 = 41
7. (July + August + September) / 3 = (40 + 45 + 48) / 3 = 133 / 3 = 44.33
8. (August + September + October) / 3 = (45 + 48 + 52) / 3 = 145 / 3 = 48.33
9. (September + October + November) / 3 = (48 + 52 + 55) / 3 = 155 / 3 = 51.67
10. (October + November + December) / 3 = (52 + 55 + 58) / 3 = 165 / 3 = 55

The moving averages for the 3-month windows are as follows:

1. 27
2. 30.33
3. 33
4. 35.67
5. 38
6. 41
7. 44.33
8. 48.33
9. 51.67
10. 55

Interpretation:
The moving average shows an increasing trend in the company's sales over the 12-month period. This indicates that the company's sales have been growing consistently throughout the year. The moving average helps to smooth out the fluctuations in the data and provides a clearer picture of the overall trend.
